content:
DataGridViewLinkCell Class

Definition

Represents a cell that contains a link.

In this Article

public class DataGridViewLinkCell : System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell

State

Remarks

The DataGridViewLinkCell class is a specialized type of DataGridViewCell used to display links.

The DataGridViewLinkColumn is the column type specialized to hold cells of this type. By default, the CellTemplate is initialized to a new DataGridViewLinkCell. To pattern the cells within a column after an existing DataGridViewLinkCell, set the column's CellTemplate property to the cell to use as a pattern.

The cell-related properties of the column are wrappers for the similarly-named properties of the template cell. Changing the property values of the template cell will affect only cells based on the template that are added after the change. Changing the cell-related property values of the column, however, will update the template cell and all other cells in the column, and refresh the column display if necessary.

Constructors

DataGridViewLinkCell()

Initializes a new instance of the DataGridViewLinkCell class.

public DataGridViewLinkCell ();

Properties

ActiveLinkColor

Gets or sets the color used to display an active link.

public System.Drawing.Color ActiveLinkColor { get; set; }
Value
Color

A Color that represents the color used to display a link that is being selected. The default value is the user's Internet Explorer setting for the color of links in the hover state.

Remarks

Setting the ActiveLinkColor property of the owning column also sets the ActiveLinkColor property of every cell in the column and refreshes the column display. To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.

EditType

Gets the type of the cell's hosted editing control.

public override Type EditType { get; }
Value
Type

Always null.

Remarks

As implemented in this class, this property always returns null because a DataGridViewLinkCell cannot be edited.

FormattedValueType

Gets the display Type of the cell value.

public override Type FormattedValueType { get; }
Value
Type

The display Type of the cell value.

LinkBehavior

Gets or sets a value that represents the behavior of a link.

public System.Windows.Forms.LinkBehavior LinkBehavior { get; set; }
Value
LinkBehavior

One of the LinkBehavior values. The default is LinkBehavior.

Exceptions
InvalidEnumArgumentException

The specified value when setting this property is not a valid LinkBehavior value.

Remarks

Examples of link behavior include whether the link always displays an underline or the link only displays an underline when the mouse pointer moves over it, and whether a double click or a single click activates a link.

Setting the LinkBehavior property of the owning column also sets the LinkBehavior property of every cell in the column and refreshes the column display. To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.

LinkColor

Gets or sets the color used to display an inactive and unvisited link.

public System.Drawing.Color LinkColor { get; set; }
Value
Color

A Color that represents the color used to initially display a link. The default value is the user's Internet Explorer setting for the link color.

Remarks

Setting the LinkColor property of the owning column also sets the LinkColor property of every cell in the column and refreshes the column display. To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.

LinkVisited

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the link was visited.

public bool LinkVisited { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the link has been visited; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

When the TrackVisitedState property is set to true, the LinkVisited property is automatically set when the link is visited.

A link is visited if it has been activated by selecting it with the mouse or keyboard.

TrackVisitedState

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the link changes color when it is visited.

public bool TrackVisitedState { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the link changes color when it is selected; otherwise, false. The default is true.

Remarks

When false, the LinkVisited property will not be automatically set to true when visited.

Setting the TrackVisitedState property of the owning column also sets the TrackVisitedState property of every cell in the column and refreshes the column display. To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.

UseColumnTextForLinkValue

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the column stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn.Text* property value is displayed as the link text.

public bool UseColumnTextForLinkValue { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the column stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn.Text* property value is displayed as the link text; false if the cell stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.FormattedValue* property value is displayed as the link text. The default is false.

Remarks

Setting the UseColumnTextForLinkValue property of the owning column also sets the UseColumnTextForLinkValue property of every cell in the column and refreshes the column display. To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.

ValueType

Gets or sets the data type of the values in the cell.

public override Type ValueType { get; }
Value
Type

A Type representing the data type of the value in the cell.

VisitedLinkColor

Gets or sets the color used to display a link that has been previously visited.

public System.Drawing.Color VisitedLinkColor { get; set; }
Value
Color

A Color that represents the color used to display a link that has been visited. The default value is the user's Internet Explorer setting for the visited link color.

Remarks

Setting the VisitedLinkColor property of the owning column also sets the VisitedLinkColor property of every cell in the column and refreshes the column display. To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.

Methods

Clone()

Creates an exact copy of this cell.

public override object Clone ();
Returns
Object

An Object that represents the cloned DataGridViewLinkCell.

Remarks

Override the Clone method whenever you derive from DataGridViewLinkCell and add new properties to the derived class.

CreateAccessibilityInstance()

Creates a new accessible object for the DataGridViewLinkCell.

protected override System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject CreateAccessibilityInstance ();
Returns
AccessibleObject

A new DataGridViewLinkCell.DataGridViewLinkCellAccessibleObject for the DataGridViewLinkCell.

Remarks

If you do not explicitly call the CreateAccessibilityInstance method, it will be called when the DataGridViewLinkCell.DataGridViewLinkCellAccessibleObject property is referenced.

Note

To get or set AccessibilityObject, you must add a reference to the Accessibility assembly installed with the .NET Framework.

Returns the bounding rectangle that encloses the cell's content area, which is calculated using the specified Graphics and cell style.

cellStyle

rowIndex
Int32

Returns
Rectangle

The Rectangle that bounds the cell's contents.

rowIndex

Returns

Calculates the preferred size, in pixels, of the cell.

protected override System.Drawing.Size GetPreferredSize (System.Drawing.Graphics graphics, System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle cellStyle, int rowIndex, System.Drawing.Size constraintSize);

DataGridViewCellStyle

A DataGridViewCellStyle that represents the style of the cell.

rowIndex
Int32

The zero-based row index of the cell.

constraintSize
Size

The cell's maximum allowable size.

Returns
Size

A Size that represents the preferred size, in pixels, of the cell.

GetValue(Int32)

Gets the value of the cell.

protected override object GetValue (int rowIndex);
rowIndex
Int32

The index of the cell's parent row.

Returns
Object

The value contained in the DataGridViewCell.

KeyUpUnsharesRow(KeyEventArgs,Int32)

Indicates whether the row containing the cell will be unshared when a key is released and the cell has focus.

protected override bool KeyUpUnsharesRow (System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs e, int rowIndex);
e
KeyEventArgs

A KeyEventArgs that contains data about the key press.

rowIndex
Int32

The index of the row containing the cell.

Returns
Boolean

true if the SPACE key was released, the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.TrackVisitedState* property is true, the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.LinkVisited* property is false, and the CTRL, ALT, and SHIFT keys are not pressed; otherwise, false.

Remarks

KeyUpUnsharesRow is called just before OnKeyUp. It must return true if the call to OnKeyUp has the effect of unsharing the row containing the cell. It should return false otherwise.

For more information about row sharing, see Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control.

MouseDownUnsharesRow(DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs)

Indicates whether the row containing the cell will be unshared when the mouse button is pressed while the pointer is over the cell.

protected override bool MouseDownUnsharesRow (System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs e);
e
DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs

A DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs that contains data about the mouse click.

Returns
Boolean

true if the mouse pointer is over the link; otherwise, false.

Remarks

MouseDownUnsharesRow is called just before OnMouseDown. It must return true if the call to OnMouseDown has the effect of unsharing the row containing the cell. It should return false otherwise.

For more information about row sharing, see Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control.

MouseLeaveUnsharesRow(Int32)

Indicates whether the row containing the cell will be unshared when the mouse pointer leaves the cell.

protected override bool MouseLeaveUnsharesRow (int rowIndex);
rowIndex
Int32

The index of the row containing the cell.

Returns
Boolean

true if the link displayed by the cell is not in the normal state; otherwise, false.

Remarks

MouseLeaveUnsharesRow is called just before OnMouseLeave. MouseLeaveUnsharesRow must return true if the call to OnMouseLeave has the effect of unsharing the row containing the cell. It should return false otherwise.

For more information about row sharing, see Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control.

MouseMoveUnsharesRow(DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs)

Indicates whether the row containing the cell will be unshared when the mouse pointer moves over the cell.

protected override bool MouseMoveUnsharesRow (System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs e);
e
DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs

A DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs that contains data about the mouse click.

Returns
Boolean

true if the mouse pointer is over the link and the link is has not yet changed color to reflect the hover state; otherwise, false.

Remarks

The MouseMoveUnsharesRow method is called just before the OnMouseMove method. It must return true if the call to OnMouseMove has the effect of unsharing the row containing the cell. It should return false otherwise.

For more information about row sharing, see Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control.

MouseUpUnsharesRow(DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs)

Indicates whether the row containing the cell will be unshared when the mouse button is released while the pointer is over the cell.

protected override bool MouseUpUnsharesRow (System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs e);
e
DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs

A DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs that contains data about the mouse click.

Returns
Boolean

true if the mouse pointer is over the link; otherwise, false.

Remarks

MouseUpUnsharesRow is called just before OnMouseUp. It must return true if the call to OnMouseUp has the effect of unsharing the row containing the cell. It should return false otherwise.

For more information about row sharing, see Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control.
